EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Supply Network
This structure is meant to convey copper plates from an extraction unit into the cable‐production facility via a dedicated belt depot and factory interface.
• Extraction Module  
 – Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x = –3.5, y = 27.5) with drop position Position(x = –3.5, y = 28.5)  
 – Adjacent wooden chest at Position(x = –3.5, y = 26.5) supporting extraction storage

• Belt Depot Module  
 – Wooden chest (serving as belt depot) at Position(x = 3.5, y = 15.5)  
 – Transport belt segment placed adjacent at Position(x = 4.5, y = 15.5)  
 – Depot burner inserter (using direction UP) at Position(x = 3.5, y = 14.5) to interface with the depot

• Factory Interface Module  
 – Cable factory input chest at Position(x = 2.5, y = 17.5)  
 – Burner inserter at Position(x = 1.5, y = 17.5) (dedicated for interface use)  
 – Burner inserter at Position(x = 3.5, y = 17.5) (placed at the copper cable factory interface)  
 – Additional connection burner inserter at Position(x = 2.5, y = 16.5)  
 – Assembling machine for copper cable production at Position(x = 1.5, y = 19.5)  
 – Wooden chest at Position(x = 1.5, y = 21.5) supporting adjacent storage  
 – Laboratory (lab_input: {automation‐science‐pack: 17}, electrical_id: 7106; position unspecified) for research support

### Electricity Generator at Position(x = –0.5, y = 24.5)
This setup is designed to generate electrical power to support connected structures.
• Steam engine (generator) at Position(x = –0.5, y = 24.5)  
• Boiler at Position(x = –5.5, y = 24.0)  
• Offshore pump at Position(x = –7.5, y = 25.5)

### Smelting Facility
This structure groups metal‐processing elements used for handling raw and processed plates.
• Stone furnace at Position(x = –3.0, y = 19.0) producing iron‐plate  
• Stone furnace at Position(x = –4.0, y = 21.0) producing copper‐plate  
• Wooden chest at Position(x = –4.5, y = 18.5) for material storage  
• Wooden chest at Position(x = –5.5, y = 21.5) for additional storage  
• Burner inserter at Position(x = –3.5, y = 23.5) aiding material handling

Additional infrastructure components (pipe groups, belt groups, and electricity groups) interconnect these structures to form an integrated production network.

ERROR TIPS
───────────
• Belt Connection Target Error  
 – When connecting transport belts, do not target a steam engine directly. Instead, use an intermediary inserter to input items into systems that include Prototype.SteamEngine objects.

• Placement Distance Error  
 – Avoid attempting to place entities (such as a wooden chest) at positions that exceed the allowed placement range. Move closer to the target position to comply with the maximum distance constraint.

• Inventory Availability Error  
 – Ensure the required item (for example, a wooden chest) is present in the player’s inventory before attempting to place it.

• Variable Reference Error  
 – Confirm that all variables (e.g. target_chest) are properly defined and referenced in the code to prevent NameErrors.
